author: @RealMattBell
title: 'Vulture': Property investor eyeing cyclone Alfred hit zone trolled
text:
Cyclone Alfred hasn’t made landfall on the Aussie coast yet but that hasn’t stopped property investors asking where they can cash in – and getting trolled for it.
It’s no secret that despite record prices since the pandemic and a history-making once-in-a-generation cyclone set to hit South East Queensland, investors continue to see the entire region as one of the hottest prospects to get the best return on their dollar.
But even investors, it seems, have limits on what they will tolerate when communities are in trouble.
Related: Aus insurers’ shock move as cyclone nears
Aussie insurers’ sick move as cyclone nears
A prominent private investor group with over 70,000 members saw one of their top contributors seek out advice on how the market is looking in the “flooded zones”.
There were some responses to “check your insurance”, but the overwhelming vibe was disbelief.
“Honestly just wait until this time next week you’ll be in luck,” was one response, but others were not so tolerant saying I “see some stupid posts in this group this one definitely up there”.
The top contributor’s previous hope for price falls in Brisbane due to flooding were resurfaced, where his view was falls in flooded riverside suburbs would make it “party time” for those that don’t in Brisbane.
“Hoping your prior prediction comes true? Keep praying!” a member on the Facebook group site said.
“Nah prices are still strong, keep ya wishing. Vulture.”
He was also hit with the ultimate insult for real world investors: “You sound like a crypto investor!”
MORE: Terrifying detail in Aussie cyclone’s path
Cyclone to smash homes of rich and famous
Some turned to ridicule: “Think proactive – apply for a pontoon license & put the property up for sale. Water view as far as the eye can see. Comes with DA for Clive Palmers yacht”.
Others retreated to sarcasm: “I would like to save the tax deductible $25 a week so I can be a multi millionaire investor. Just thought this was the dumb question thread”.
But reality set in when a Gold Coast resident and fellow property investor chimed in from the region that’s set to face the worst effects when Alfred makes landfall.
It “hasn’t even happened yet,” she said. “Give us a minute to actually make sure our own houses, families and pets are safe”.
“Thanks for caring. ITS ABOUT TO HIT ME, I’m on the Gold Coast and Brisbane border”.
MORE: Surprise move amid insurance blackouts for home buyers
There is no expectation that the history-making cyclone will dent the massive demand that exists and will continue to exist for Aussie suburbs within the cyclone warning zone stretching from Noosa in the north to past Byron Bay in the south.
“This is Australia, everything is out to kill us. The fear will soon pass,” a local investor said.
Another directed the investor to a different business segment, saying “the market for selling water & toilet paper in Brisbane right now is on fire”.
Brisbane and Gold Coast were considered top locations for investors, though price rises mean cash flow is not as good as it may have been in the past, was the view of the investor group administrator before the cyclone appeared.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->construction and property

author: Daniela Arcanjo
title: Israel prende jovem que se negou a servir no Exército - 28/12/2023 - Mundo - Folha
text:
O israelense Tal Mitnick, 18, negou-se a servir no Exrcito em meio ao conflito que se desenrola na Faixa de Gaza , chamado por ele de "guerra de vingana". Trata-se do primeiro caso do tipo desde os ataques do grupo terrorista Hamas contra o sul de Israel no dia 7 de outubro, que deixaram cerca de 1.200 mortos.
"Eu me recuso a acreditar que mais violncia trar segurana, eu me recuso a participar de uma guerra de vingana", afirmou ele em comunicado reproduzido pelo jornal israelense Jerusalem Post. "O ataque criminoso em Gaza no vai resolver o massacre brutal que o Hamas executou."
Tal Mitnick, 18, jovem que recusou-se a integrar o Exrcito de Israel - @Mesarvot no Twitter "Cresci em um lar onde a vida sagrada, onde a discusso valorizada e onde o dilogo e o entendimento sempre vm antes de medidas violentas. No mundo cheio de interesses corruptos em que vivemos, a violncia e a guerra so apenas mais uma maneira de aumentar o apoio ao governo e silenciar crticas", acrescentou, em uma referncia ao momento de instabilidade poltica que Israel vivia antes do incio do conflito .
Mitnick tambm pediu por diplomacia e esforo poltico ao relembrar o cessar-fogo da ltima semana de novembro , no qual 105 refns foram libertados pelo Hamas ao longo de uma semana em troca da libertao de 210 mulheres e adolescentes palestinos das prises de Israel.
"Devemos reconhecer o fato de que, aps semanas de operao terrestre em Gaza, no final das contas foram negociaes e um acordo que trouxeram de volta os refns", afirmou.
L fora Receba no seu email uma seleo semanal com o que de mais importante aconteceu no mundo
Carregando...
O adolescente ainda citou o episdio em que o Exrcito de Israel matou por engano trs refns do pas .
"Por causa da mentira criminosa de que 'no h civis inocentes em Gaza', at mesmo refns que acenavam uma bandeira branca e gritavam em hebraico foram mortos a tiros. No quero imaginar quantos casos semelhantes houve que no foram investigados porque as vtimas nasceram do lado errado da cerca", disse ele.
Mitnick foi condenado a 30 dias de priso, uma sentena considerada severa para o seu caso, j que foi a primeira recusa de sua vida.
O jovem integra a Rede Mesarvot, um grupo de jovens que se negam a se alistar no Exrcito de Israel alegando princpios ticos ou morais. Parte dos integrantes do movimento estava com ele no momento em que ele entrou no centro de alistamento de Tel Hashomer, na ltima tera-feira (26).
A iniciativa no indita. Um dos casos mais recentes aconteceu neste ano, quando a sociedade israelense estava em ebulio por causa da controversa reforma judicial promovida pela coalizo do atual primeiro-ministro, Binyamin Netanyahu a mais direita da histria do pas. Segundo crticos, o projeto de lei poderia minar a democracia israelense, o que provocou manifestaes massivas por semanas.
Guerra transforma Gaza em cemitrio para crianas ic_save

Em protesto contra os planos de Bibi, como o premi tambm chamado, mais de mil reservistas da Fora Area de Israel divulgaram uma carta em julho ameaando abandonar seus deveres de servio voluntrio. Na poca, havia uma onda de reservistas que diziam se negar a servir a um pas antidemocrtico.

author: Remodelista Team
title: The World’s Most Beautiful Light Switches, by Way of France – Remodelista Web Story
text:
The World's Most Beautiful Light Switches, by Way of France - Remodelista
French company Meljac was founded by Andre Bousquet, an engineer by trade who noticed that electrical equipment was lacking in the aesthetics department. A line of sockets, switches, and other fittings featuring refined finishes and quality craftsmanship.
Meljac hardware is available to the trade in the US through LVL.
Meljac’s designs are inspired by industrial 1930s France; notice the drop-shaped toggle switch.
Meljac hardware is made in France of high-quality brass. Contact LVL for pricing and ordering information.
The Eclipse Collection Plate 1 Two-Way Switch, shown in rifle gun slate.
Above L: The Oval 1 Two-Way Switch in brushed nickel.
Meljac offers a range of controls for lighting as well as temperature and sound. Here, the simple Plate 1 Dimmer Switch (a European model).
Reminiscent of nautical hardware, the Round Plate 1 Ground Socket has a water-resistant cover.
The Plate 1 Socket with Cover is made of thick brass.
Meljac’s first products were switches and sockets, but its range soon expanded to other tools such as thermostats and doorbells.
Not upgrading your electrical system anytime soon?
Read more

author: Philip FONG
title: Higher energy costs contributed to a jump in Japanese inflation in November
text:
Higher energy costs contributed to a jump in Japanese inflation in November
- Philip FONG
- Updated
Tags
As featured on
Japanese inflation accelerated in November, with prices rising 2.7 percent on-year partly due to higher energy costs, government data showed Friday.
Japanese inflation accelerated in November, with prices rising 2.7 percent on-year partly because of higher energy costs, government data showed Friday.
